frameDefinitions: An Entity changes from a Prior_state to a Post_state in a sequence that follows a pre-defined plan, expectation, or model of change.
This frame contains words for types of noise which can be used to characterize verbal communication.
A stretch of linguistic discourse or a Text that a Communicator produces has a Topic that it is about.
An Event with multiple Participants takes place.
The answer to a Question is under discussion in a Group, which still  has a difference of opinion among its members.
This frame is for words that denote highly schematic entities.
frameExamples: Their offensive armament has <t>developed</t> from short range missiles to long-range ballistic weaponry in a relatively short period .
'Don't treat me as a child!' she <t>cried</t> scornfully.
MATAC looks forward to your <t>participation</t> in helping promote telework in the Mid-Atlantic region.
Firstly, it is quite clear the <t>issue</t> in this context was not so much apostasy as much as it was treason.
We found an unusual wooden <t>object</t> in the desert.
listRoleDefinitions: The object that undergoes change.
The time at which the progress occurs.
The location where the Progress occurs.
<fen>Speaker</fen> is the sentient entity that delivers the <fen>Message</fen>.
Message has a number of different realizations in this frame, including <ment>that</ment>-clauses, direct quotes, infinitival complements, <ment>for-to</ment> phrases, and NP Objects.
<fen>Topic</fen> occurs in PP Complements, usually headed by <ment>about</ment>.
The <fen>Voice</fen> describes the <fex name=''>Speaker'</fex>s utterance or other message-encoded production.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> where the Communication noise event occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where an event occurs.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is what a <fen>Text</fen> is about.
A set of propositions that is coherent in being about a <fen>Topic</fen>
The <fen>Communicator</fen> is the person who has produced a <fen>Text</fen> on a <fen>Topic</fen>.
The time at which the <fen>Communicator</fen> produces <fen>Text</fen> on a <fen>Topic</fen>.
The individuals or entities that have been participants in an <fen>Event</fen>.
<fen>Participant_1</fen> is the grammatically more prominent participant in an <fen>Event</fen> with multiple <fen>Participants</fen>.
A grammatically less prominent participant of an <fen>Event</fen> with multiple <fen>Participants</fen>.
An <fen>Event</fen> with multiple <fen>Participants</fen>, who may or may not be involved intentionally.
A group, location, or institution conventionally associated with an <fen>Event</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the multiple-participant <fen>Event</fen> occurs.
The location where the <fen>Event</fen> involving multiple <fen>Participants</fen> occurs.
The <fen>Question</fen> is an open proposition the answer to which is under dispute.
The time interval during which the <fen>Question</fen> exists as a problem for the <fen>Group</fen>.
A thing (either abstract or physical) that exists with some degree of permanence.
listRoleExamples: Advances <fex>in marketing techniques</fex> have since rendered it obsolete.
<fex>When</fex> did the X-wing progress beyond the drawing board?
Kim howled <fex>about the unfairness of it all</fex>.
<fex>John's voice</fex> bellowed for her to be quiet.
In his book, <fex>Smithers</fex> discusses cotton production.
Thereafter, <fex>everybody</fex> participated in the 17 May parade ending in the Nordic Club.
Last year, <fex>Bill</fex> participated in the Montana State University Earth Systems Science distance learning course in the Atmosphere Unit.

The Second Amended Complaint alleges that Andrew S. Pitt ('Pitt'), Conectisys Corporation ('Conectisys' or the 'Company'), and BM
Capital Corp. participated <fex>with Zaman and Smith Benton</fex> in a fraudulent and manipulative trading scheme.
Some who participated <fex>in D-Day</fex> are finally ready to talk about it
Several of the countries were unable to participate <fex>in the market</fex> .

A survey of students who participated <fex>last year</fex> showed that 61 percent would be the
first in their family to attend college.
The most exciting tours for Mr. Osako were when he participated <fex>in France, Belgium, Holland, Cuba and Japan</fex>.
The issue is <fex>who will have control of Iraq's rich oil resources</fex>.

The issue <fex>at the time</fex> was whether or not to relocate the Rennes-based part of
the team to California.
